newsitem.title: USA: Newport News to join S&P MidCap 400 Index.
newsitem.headline: Newport News to join S&P MidCap 400 Index.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said on Wednesday it will add Newport News Shipbuilding to the S&P MidCap 400 Index after the close of trading in Wednesday, December 11, 1996.
Tenneco Inc is spinning off the Newport News operations and selling its Tenneco Energy unit to El Paso Energy Corp on that date.
Tenneco will remain in the S&P 500 Index, while El Paso Energy will remain in the S&P MidCap 400 Index, Standard & Poor's said.

Newport News will replace Borland International Inc in the S&P MidCap 400 Index, Standard & Poor's said. Borland International, which had a market capitalization of $281.8 million at the close of trading on December 3, will not be added to another S&P Index at that time.

Standard & Poor's also said it will replace Augat Inc in the SmallCap 600 Index with Fritz Cos Inc on December 11, 1996. Augat is being acquired by S&P 500 component Thomas & Betts Corp, Standard & Poor's said.
